Posts.Content: Chocolovely I'm sorry  I don;t know if the side effects of Tamoxifen causes depression, but will be interested to see as I am due to start taking it in the near future. I am sorry you feel so low though, maybe those tears have waited a long time to come. Take care Hannah X
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen ..... depression

Posts.Content: I bought some from M@S they looked good in the shop but have never had them on as they are either not comfy or didn't look right. The nicest I have found has been 'amoena' my breast cancer nurse gave me a one of their books and they are on line. They have some lovely things. Take care and hope you find what you are looking for. Hannah
Posts.Title: Help with finding matching MX underwear

Posts.Content: I can see at times there are reasons why a persons privacy has to come second to treatment, but I know sometimes privacy isn't respected when it should be.  I had a male radiologist come in and have a conversation about lunch when I was I was lying down and exposed when I had a procedure before my first op. I have been asked so many times to come into a room and get undressed, walk over to a bed a lie down with people in the room watching. (All it would take would be a screen in the room to get undressed behind and a front fastening gown to put on.) I was put on a mixed ward after my mastectomy . I have like many women experienced a lot of trauma and sexual abuse in my childhood and have had a diagnosis of  post traumatic stress. Having cancer and going through treatment is traumatic enough, but for those of us that have also experienced sexual abuse it is traumatic on different levels. I also work with women who are survivors sexual abuse and so many are frightened to go for routine screening because of triggers to their past abuse, I know lives could be saved with an understanding of good sensitive practice guidelines being introduced. Sorry - Rant over, but it does really upset me. Hannah
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy and privacy

Posts.Content: franm_1962 Hi, I was diagnosed with breast cancer ten years ago in December. I have been told that I have a cancerous lump in my armpit on the same side as the original diagnosis. Ten years ago I had a mastectomy and 26 lymph nodes remove and there was cancer in two of the nodes. Has anyone had the same, Does anyone know the recovery time for this current one. I have been told that it hasn't spread anywhere else. Thanks Fran
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer 2nd time around

Posts.Content: Hiya I was told I would probably put weight on as a side effect of  chemo and again later with starting the hormone treatment, but I haven't, I have and continue to loose weight, so no not everyone gaqins weight. Take care Hannah X
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy - weight gain?

Posts.Content: Hi sweetheart just sending a big hug, have been thinking about you today XX
Posts.Title: Wish me luck please

Posts.Content: Hi mbreen My name is Hannah and my grandson who I have looked after since her was born got chickenpox when I was having chemo. I rang the hospital and was told it was really important to get someone else to look after him as it could be dangerous if u havent had chickenpox yourself and having chemo. I too didnt have anyone to look after him and was told by a nurse to ware gloves and protective clothing when looking after him - impossible when u have a poorly 2 year old coming in for a cuddle in the night - anyway they gave me anti viral tables and I was fine. I was led to believe it was a risk if u havent had chickenpox yourself - but I must admit I was given conflicting information form different health professionals. Hope u say well and sending a hug to you and your daughter X Hannah
Posts.Title: Chickenpox!!!

Posts.Content: Hiya Tweedledee I've just had my 2nd mx and have had it drained wkly since op and yes it does hurt a little after - feeling more sore as time goes on - sorry! Hope you get the go ahead for your chemo starting though - as I know how important that is to us when we are waiting. Big hug Hannah X
Posts.Title: Seroma

Posts.Content: Hiya Helen I think it's really important to have any lump we find checked out, and i would start with calling my bc nurse or calling the nurses tomorrow on this site and take it from there. I had fluid collect after my lumpectomy, but don;t know if that would have drained on its own as I went back for a mastectomy. I would have it checked out through. Take care treasure Hannah X
Posts.Title: Advise

Posts.Content: Hiya jc11 Just a little note to let you know i had bad headaches and fuzzy eyes throughout my chemo and it continued quite a while after it had finished and was having  rads and beyond. I think it's always important to talk to onc about symptoms though. Drink plenty of water especially in this weather. good luck on you chemo journey Take care Hannah X
Posts.Title: FEC and headaches - fuzzy eyes

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply I maybe will ring. Think I'm just worried - I have let my BCN and oncologist know and I'm going for a CT scan Thursday. I don't think I'm dehydrated I spend half the night getting up to go to the loo. I can't believe I got to nearly the end of the chemo part of treatment to 'black out' crossing the road and nearly got run over - story of my life really!!
Posts.Title: hiya I'm hannah and new to this site

Posts.Content: Thank you for sharing that just needed to know it had  happened to other people during chemo because it's worrying  X
Posts.Title: hiya I'm hannah and new to this site

Posts.Content: Hi poemgalore hope you are ok after fec 2 I experienced  the side effects worse after the 1st one and not so bad on the others - except the blackouts. I do go dizzy at times and haven't had my blood pressure taken.I don't remember though going dizzy when Ive blacked out I just find myself on the floor - last time when i was crossing the road. hoping it will stop soon cos Ive just had my last fec. I am going for a ct scan tomorrow just to check everything is ok though. Thanks to everyone that has replied Hannah  X
Posts.Title: hiya I'm hannah and new to this site

Posts.Content: Hi I was diagnosed with grade 3 breast cancer last August with lymph node involvement. I had two operations and have just had my last chemo. I am due to start rads for 5 wks on the 12th March and hormone tablets. I have been having really bad headaches and have recently blacked out which was very frightening. Has anyone else who had had or is in treatment had the same side effects, and did they stop after chemo finished. Thanks hannah X
Posts.Title: hiya I'm hannah and new to this site

Posts.Content: Hiya welcome to the site sweetheart I think you have done well to have worked up to now. Everyone is different and reacts differently, and also probably depends what job you do and if they are supportive. I worked through a lot of chemo time except the first week of each chemo, and worked through rads, although sometimes worked from home cos i think it was my way of coping, but since I have finished I cant get up in the morning and just cant stop sleeping - relief probably! Just listen to what your body is telling you, and be kind to yourself. Take care treasure, big hug Hannah X
Posts.Title: hi, new to the site

Posts.Content: Oh still must have chemo brain! - posted answer to the wrong post - so sorry X Be kind to yourself too though - your body and emotions are going through such a hard time, take care sweetheart Hannah XX
Posts.Title: hi, new to the site

Posts.Content: Hiya I'm Hannah, I'm so glad your results showed no new spread, and that you are feeling more confident. I asked for copies of my results and tests and I felt to be more informed gave me a level of choice and control when everything felt so out of control. I could then talk to the nurses on the site if I needed anything explaining and was able then to go back with questions if I needed. I was never offered them but have asked and it has never a problem. Take care and sending a hug X
Posts.Title: Copies of results etc.

Posts.Content: Hiya Alirose Just a little note to say we will be thinking about you, and wish you well in the next part of your journey. Sending a huh Take care treasure Hannah X
Posts.Title: Anxiety re mx and reconstruction
